snippet: Mr. Borge, the last surviving founder of the Sandinista rebel group that toppled Nicaragua’s dictatorship in 1979, went from student radical to one of the leading officials of his nation’s government.
abstract: Tomas Borge Martinez, founder of Sandinista rebel group that toppled Nicaragua's dictatorship in 1979 and former interior minister in the revolutionary government, dies at age 81. Photo (M)p
lead_paragraph: Tomás Borge Martínez, the last surviving founder of the Sandinista rebel group that toppled Nicaragua's dictatorship in 1979 and a former feared interior minister in the revolutionary government, died on Monday in Managua. He was 81. His death was announced by Rosario Murillo, the wife of President Daniel Ortega. Mr. Borge was being treated for pneumonia at a military hospital in Managua when he died, she said.

headline.main: Tomás Borge Martínez, Sandinista Rebel And Nicaragua Interior Minister, Dies at 81
